goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions

Class ParserException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException
          • goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions.ParserException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExtendedParserException, InvalidSemanticsException

    public class ParserException
extends org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException
    An extension to RecognitionException, where the input stream may be set after creation. Also a single reason may be given why the exception occurred.
    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • parserLexer

        protected java.lang.String parserLexer
        From what part of the parsing process the exception came from. Should be either parser or lexer.

      • sourceFile

        protected java.io.File sourceFile
        The source of this error. Will not be printed when null.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParserException

        public ParserException(java.lang.String reason)
        Creates a new ParserException for some reason, without any link to where the source of the error lies. Info may be added later by calling setInputStream(IntStream).
        Parameters:
        reason - Why the new exception occurred.

      • ParserException

        public ParserException(java.lang.String reason,
               java.lang.String sourceType)
        Creates a new ParserException for some reason, without any link to where the source of the error lies. Info may be added later by calling setInputStream(IntStream).
        Parameters:
        reason - Why the new exception occurred.
        sourceType - The type of the source of the exception. Usually 'GOAL' or 'Prolog'. Used when converting the exception to a string. Default is 'GOAL'.

      • ParserException

        public ParserException(org.antlr.runtime.IntStream input,
               java.lang.String reason)
        Creates a new ParserException for some reason, with info where the source of the error lies.
        Parameters:
        input - A reference to the faulty stream, at the position of the error made by the user.
        reason - Why the new exception occurred.

      • ParserException

        public ParserException(InputStreamPosition source,
               java.lang.String reason)
        Creates a new ParserException for some reason, with info where the source of the error lies.
        Parameters:
        source - A pointer to where in the input stream this exception originated.
        reason - Why the new exception occurred.

               java.lang.String reason,

        Parameters:

        reason - Why the new exception occurred.
        sourceType - The type of the source of the exception. Usually 'GOAL' or 'Prolog'. Used when converting the exception to a string. Default is 'GOAL'.

        public ParserException(InputStreamPosition source,
               java.lang.String reason,
               java.lang.String sourceType)
        Creates a new ParserException for some reason, with info where the source of the error lies.
        Parameters:

        reason - Why the new exception occurred.
        sourceType - The type of the source of the exception. Usually 'GOAL' or 'Prolog'. Used when converting the exception to a string. Default is 'GOAL'.

      • ParserException

        public ParserException(org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException re,
               java.lang.String[] tokenNames)
        Creates a ParserException based on a RecognitionException .
        Main use is to print a RE in a similar way as a GOAL RE.
        Parameters:
        re - The RecognitionException to base the new exception on.
        tokenNames - The names of the tokens the given RE is referencing to.

      • ParserException

        public ParserException(org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException re,
               java.lang.String[] tokenNames,
               java.lang.String sourceType)
        Creates a ParserException based on a RecognitionException .
        Main use is to print a RE in a similar way as a GOAL RE.
        Parameters:
        re - The RecognitionException to base the new exception on.
        tokenNames - The names of the tokens the given RE is referencing to.
        sourceType - The type of the source of the exception. Usually 'GOAL' or 'Prolog'. Used when converting the exception to a string. Default is 'GOAL'.

      • ParserException

        public ParserException(org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException re,
               java.lang.String[] tokenNames,
               java.lang.String sourceType,
               java.lang.String parserLexer)
        Creates a ParserException based on a RecognitionException .
        Main use is to print a RE in a similar way as a GOAL RE.
        Parameters:
        re - The RecognitionException to base the new exception on.
        tokenNames - The names of the tokens the given RE is referencing to.
        sourceType - The type of the source of the exception. Usually 'GOAL' or 'Prolog'. Used when converting the exception to a string. Default is 'GOAL'.
        parserLexer - From what part of the parsing process the error came. Should be either parser or lexer.

        Copies info about the line and character position from an ANTLR recognition exception, so we do not have to try and do it ourselves.
        Parameters:
        rex - The RecognitionException that possibly contains information about the position of an error.

      • getParserLexer

        public java.lang.String getParserLexer()
        Returns:
        A String indicating from where in the parsing process this error was generated. Usually 'Parser' or 'Lexer'.

        Sets the part of the parsing process this exception originated from. Usually 'Parser' or 'Lexer'
        Parameters:
        newParserLexer - The new origin of this exception.

      • appendAtLinePositionString

        public void appendAtLinePositionString(java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
        Appends info about the line number and location of the origin of this exception, but only if that information was set.
        Parameters:
        builder - To which builder to append the info.

      • getReasonFrom

        public static java.lang.String getReasonFrom(org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException re,
                             java.lang.String[] tokenNames)
        Creates a string that describes the reason why a RecognitionException may have been thrown, in a way that the user can understand. Generates a custom message for most subclasses of RecognitionException, and others use a generic message (although these should still be precise enough in most cases).
        Parameters:
        re - The RecognitionException that has been thrown.
        tokenNames - Names of the tokens the given RE is referring to.
        Returns:
        A string describing the RE in an understandable way.

      • getUnexpectedTokenName

        public static java.lang.String getUnexpectedTokenName(org.antlr.runtime.Token t,
                                      java.lang.String[] tokenNames)
        Gets the name of some unexpected token.
        Parameters:
        t - The unexpected token
        tokenNames - The names of all valid tokens (the result of a Parser.getTokenNames() call; not a list of expected tokens).
        Returns:
        A string-representation of the unexpected tokens. The returned string contains single-quotes around the token.

      • getUnexpectedTokenName

        public static java.lang.String getUnexpectedTokenName(int t,
                                      java.lang.String[] tokenNames)
        Gets the name of some unexpected token.
        Parameters:
        t - The unexpected token type or char of the unexpected input element
        tokenNames - The names of all valid tokens (the result of a Parser.getTokenNames() call; not a list of expected tokens).
        Returns:
        A string-representation of the unexpected tokens. The returned string contains single-quotes around the token.

      • getReadableErrorMessage

        public static java.lang.String getReadableErrorMessage(org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException rex,
                                       java.lang.String[] tokenNames,
                                       java.lang.String parserLexer,
                                       java.lang.String sourceType)
        Converts a RecognitionException into a message that can easily be read by the user. If the exception is not a (subclass of) ParserException already, it is converted into one and then the toString method is called.
        Parameters:
        rex - The exception the user needs to be made aware of. Note that an is assumed to be originating from a GOAL parser if it is a RecognitionException and not a FailedPredicateException. Call ParserException#GOALRecognitionException(RecognitionException, String[], String) to get a message for prolog exceptions.
        tokenNames - The names of the tokens possibly used by the exception.
        parserLexer - From what part of the parsing process the error came. Should be either parser or lexer.
        sourceType - A string describing what part of the parse sequence the error came from. Usually MAS or GOAL.
        Returns:
        A string-representation of the given exception.

      • occurredBefore

        public boolean occurredBefore(ParserException other)
        Determines if this exception occurred before another parser exception by comparing the line and character position.
        Parameters:
        other - Some other parser exception.
        Returns:
        true if this exception occurred before the other given exception, or if the input position of the other exception has not been set.
